source_sentence: 「時諸苾芻咸皆有疑，而白佛言：『世尊！
translation: "The monks then all had doubts and said to the Buddha, 'Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 是具一切智能斷諸疑。
translation: "They have all the intelligence to end doubts.

source_sentence: 我等不審，優樓頻螺作何業故？
translation: We don't ask, "What's the deed of the turtle Uluvilvā?

source_sentence: 以五百神變而能調伏。
translation: By using 500 miracles, he's able to tame them.

source_sentence: 那提迦攝、伽耶迦攝任運調伏？』
translation: Can Nādika and Gayāśa subdue them at will?'

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：『彼迦攝波所集資糧業，汝等善聽，我當為說。』
translation: The Buddha addressed the monks, 'Listen well to this work of accumulation that Kāśyapa has gathered, and I will explain it for you.'

source_sentence: 乃至頌曰如前。
translation: And the verse goes on as before.

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：『往古昔時，此賢劫中人壽二萬歲，有佛世尊號曰迦攝如來，十號具足，出現於世，在波羅痆斯城仙人墮處施鹿園中。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, 'Once upon a time, during a life of 20,000 years in this good eon, there was a Buddha, the Bhagavān named Kāśyapa Tathāgata, complete with all ten epithets, who appeared in the world and was in a deer park in the city of Bārāṇasī where immortals had fallen.

source_sentence: 時彼世尊佛事已畢而入涅槃，時有國王名吉利枳，積諸香木而用焚燒，復以香乳灑火令滅，以四寶瓶盛其舍利，於形勝地起窣堵波，縱廣一踰繕那、高半踰繕那。
translation: When that Bhagavān had finished his Buddha-works and entered nirvāṇa, a king named Girikṣa gathered wood for burning, sprinkled the fire with scented milk to make it go out, filled a four-jewel vase with his relics, and raised a stūpa on a site of outstanding form that was more than a yojana wide and more than half a yojana high.

source_sentence: 時波羅痆斯城有一長者，其家巨富，財寶豐饒多有受用，如薜室羅末拏天。
translation: At the time, there was an elder in Pārāṇasī whose family was very wealthy and had an abundance of wealth and possessions, like the god Vaiśravaṇa.

source_sentence: 而彼長者，於同類家娶女為妻，共相娛樂後生三子。
translation: That elder took a woman as his wife from a similar family, and they had three sons after they shared an amorous relationship.

source_sentence: 長者後時忽染疾病，種種方藥不能得差，奄就命終。
translation: The elder then suddenly became ill and was unable to obtain various prescriptions for his illness, and he died soon afterwards.

source_sentence: 時彼子等，種種繒綵裝飾其輿，送彼寒林以火焚燒，號叫悲泣喪事已畢。
translation: His sons then decorated their mourning cloths with various silken fabrics, sent them to the cold forest to be burned, and lamented the end of the funeral.

source_sentence: 時長兄言：「所有財物吾今欲分。」
translation: The eldest brother then said, "Now, I want to share all of my possessions."

source_sentence: 時彼二弟而不隨從。
translation: The two younger brothers then didn't follow suit.

source_sentence: 其兄數數言欲分之，二弟報曰：「若如此者，先修福業然後聽分。」
translation: The older brother repeatedly said that he wanted to share it, but the second brother replied, "If that's the case, cultivate good actions first, and then you'll hear about sharing it."

source_sentence: 兄言：「作何等業？」
translation: The brother said, "What kind of actions will you do?"

source_sentence: 弟曰：「於迦攝佛窣堵波處而為供養。」
translation: The younger brother said, "Make offerings to Kāśyapa Buddha at his stūpa."

source_sentence: 時兄不信，多時致難，後始隨許。
translation: The older brother didn't believe him and repeatedly raised objections, but he later agreed.

source_sentence: 其二弟以種種珍異，於迦攝佛窣堵波所作供養已，便發願言：「由此善根，願我同於迦攝波佛、應、正等覺所，授最上記：『摩納婆！
translation: After they had made offerings to Kāśyapa Buddha's stūpa with various treasures, the two brothers then vowed, "From these good roots, may I be granted the supreme assurance that I'll be with Kāśyapa Buddha, the worthy and perfectly enlightened one, 'Māṇava!'

source_sentence: 汝於來世人壽百歲時，當得作佛號釋迦牟尼如來、應、正等覺，彼佛法中而得出家，獲殊勝果。』」
translation: When you live to be a hundred years old in the future, you will become a buddha named Śākyamuni, the Tathāgata, the Worthy One, and the Completely Enlightened One, and among those buddhas you will attain home and attain excellent results.'"

source_sentence: 兄聞弟等發是願已，頂禮雙足即發善願。
translation: After hearing that our younger brother had made this vow, he bowed his head at his feet and made a good vow.

source_sentence: 而我惡性不信正法，由此隨喜善根，亦於彼釋迦牟尼佛，與我五百神變，而見調伏令我出家，既出家已便獲勝果。
translation: Because of this good root of liking what's wrong and disbelieving the right teaching, I was also given five hundred miraculous powers by Śākyamuni Buddha, who tamed me and made me leave home, and then I attained the excellent result after leaving home.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻勿作異念，彼長兄急性不信正法者，是優樓頻螺迦攝。
translation: Don't think differently, you monks, for that elder brother who acutely disbelieves in the right teaching is Uruvilvāraka.

source_sentence: 其二弟者，即那提迦攝、伽耶迦攝等。
translation: His two younger brothers are Nadī-Kāśyapa and Gayā-Kāśyapa.

source_sentence: 是由願力故，以五百神變而能調伏之，其那提迦攝、伽耶迦攝而易調伏。
translation: Because of the power of their vows, they're able to subdue them with five hundred miracles, and Nādika and Gayākāśyapa are easy to subdue.

source_sentence: 頻毘娑羅王為太子時，王舍城中有一長者，彼有園苑花菓茂盛，心常愛戀。
translation: When King Bimbisāra was crown prince, there was an elderly man in Rājagṛha who had a garden full of flowers and fruits that he always loved.

source_sentence: 時頻毘娑羅太子出外，乃見彼園苑，見已即便生愛樂想，告長者曰：「卿可與我此園苑。」
translation: When he went out, Prince Bimbisāra saw the garden and when he saw it, he had a vision of what he liked and told the elder, "You can give me this garden."

source_sentence: 長者心生悋惜，竟不與之。
translation: The man's heart became miserable, and he didn't give it to him.

source_sentence: 如此三返皆不隨從，太子復告曰：「與汝財物園可屬我。」
translation: After he didn't follow him three times, the prince then told him, "I'll give you the property and the garden."

source_sentence: 彼答太子曰：「乍可出國終不能與。」
translation: He answered the prince, "If I could leave the country for a while, I wouldn't be able to give it to him."

source_sentence: 太子復告長者：「當念我言：『若得王位必定取之。』」
translation: The prince then again told the elder, "Remember what I said, 'If you win the throne, I'll surely take it.'"

source_sentence: 長者答曰：「汝得王位我必當出。」
translation: The elder replied, "If you win the throne, I will surely leave."

source_sentence: 太子曰：「汝可記憶，我是頻毘娑羅太子。」
translation: The prince said, "You can remember that I'm Prince Bimbisāra."

source_sentence: 作是語已便即迴車。
translation: After he said that, he then returned to his chariot.

source_sentence: 乃至後時，大蓮華王而年衰老，奄就命終，便以太子紹王。
translation: It wasn't until much later that the great lotus king grew old and was nearing the end of his life that he adopted the crown prince as king.

source_sentence: 既得王位，強力奪彼園苑。
translation: Once he had won the throne, he forcibly seized his garden.

source_sentence: 彼長者便生熱惱，而得心病，怨恨而死。
translation: That elder then became agitated, got a mental illness, resented it, and died.

source_sentence: 於此園中住，作一毒蛇，其蛇常於王所伺求方便。
translation: While living in this garden, he created a viper that used to go to the king's quarters to seek his aid.

source_sentence: 後於芳春之月，王與宮人及諸婇女，往詣園中除去左右，與諸眷屬歡喜受樂，便即睡眠。
translation: Later, in the spring moon, the king, his palace staff, and his women went to the garden, removed their heads, rejoiced with their retinues, and enjoyed themselves, and then went to sleep.

source_sentence: 諸女愛花皆捨王去，唯有一女執刀而衛護王。
translation: The women who loved the flowers all left the king, but one woman held a sword and guarded him.

source_sentence: 是時彼蛇見諸女眾皆悉遊散，從穴疾出而欲螫王。
translation: Seeing all the women scattered, that snake quickly emerged from its den, intending to sting the king.

source_sentence: 王福力故，羯蘭鐸迦鳥圍遶其蛇而眾發聲，彼執刀女聞眾鳥聲，復見毒蛇而來向王，即以利刀斷彼蛇命。
translation: When the woman holding the sword heard the sound of the birds and saw the viper coming toward the king, she used her sharp sword to cut off the life of the viper.

source_sentence: 女為怖故便發大呼，時王從睡驚寤而起，便問女言：「此為何事？」
translation: Out of fear, she cried out, and the king rose from his sleep and asked her, "What's the matter here?"

source_sentence: 女報王曰：「毒蛇欲來螫王，羯蘭鐸迦鳥群聲遶蛇，我已斷訖。」
translation: The woman reported to the king, "The viper was about to come and sting the king, and I stopped it with the sound of a flock of kalandaka birds surrounding it."

source_sentence: 王聞此事，便勅太子群臣，集王舍城所有人民，在此園苑遠近盈滿聞亂發聲。
translation: When the king heard this, he ordered the crown prince and his ministers to gather all the people of Rājagṛha and fill the park with people from near and far who had heard the disturbing sounds.

source_sentence: 其王善治國境內外，諸人聞已皆大悲泣，王告諸人：「若剎帝利灌頂王，有人救命合酬何願？」
translation: After the people heard this, they all wept greatly, and the king told them, "What would be the reward for someone saving the life of the king consecrated by Zetri?"

source_sentence: 群臣白王：「合酬彼人半國之賞。」
translation: The ministers said to the king, "Let's reward them for half the country."

source_sentence: 王言：「羯蘭鐸迦鳥而救我命。
translation: The king said, "The Kalandaka bird saved my life.

source_sentence: 若如是者，宜與半國之賞。」
translation: If that's the case, it would be appropriate to give him half the reward of the kingdom."

source_sentence: 大臣復白王曰：「羯蘭鐸迦鳥而非人類，縱得王賞將何所用？
translation: The ministers again said to the king, "What use would the Kalandaka bird be if it were a reward from the king, even though it's not a human being?

source_sentence: 其此園苑，施與羯蘭鐸迦鳥，復於終身供給飲食。」
translation: Here, he gives the Kalandaka bird a garden and offers it food and drink for the rest of his life."

source_sentence: 王曰：「如卿所言。」
translation: The king said, 'As you say.'

source_sentence: 時諸群臣令其園苑周遍蒔竹，以此緣故，號為羯蘭鐸迦竹園。』
translation: The ministers then caused the garden to be surrounded by bamboo, and for that reason it was called the Kalandaka Bamboo Garden.'

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊遊行摩羯陀人間王舍城外，在一樹下便住其處。
translation: "The Bhagavān then marched outside the city of Rājagṛha among the people of Mākāṇḍa and stayed there under a tree.

source_sentence: 時影勝王聞佛到王舍城外在一樹下，與諸眷屬出王舍城，來詣佛所頂禮佛足退坐一面。
translation: When King Jingsheng heard that the Buddha had arrived outside Rājagṛha under a tree, he left Rājagṛha with his retinue, went to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊為說妙法，示教利喜已默然而住。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the wonderful Dharma for him, showed him the benefits of his teaching, and quietly withdrew to sit there.

source_sentence: 時影勝王從座而起，偏袒右肩、右膝著地、合掌恭敬而白佛言：『唯願世尊及諸苾芻，於明晨朝受我微供。』
translation: King Yama rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together in respect, and said to the Buddha, 'Please, Bhagavān, and the monks and nuns, accept my humble offerings in the morning.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊默然受請。
translation: The Bhagavān then quietly accepted the invitation.

source_sentence: 時影勝王知佛受請頂禮佛足還至本宮，勅諸眷屬，令辦種種微妙飲食敷設床座，於彼座前，寶瓶盛水安置會中。
translation: Knowing that the Buddha had accepted the invitation, King Jōshō bowed his head at his feet and returned to his palace, ordered his retinue to prepare a variety of wonderful foods and drinks, spread out a seat, and placed a jeweled vase full of water in front of the seat.

source_sentence: 既敷設已便勅使者，往世尊所白言：『時到。』
translation: Once it was prepared, he then ordered his messengers to go to the Bhagavān and say, 'The time has come.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，於晨朝時著衣持鉢，與苾芻眾前後圍遶，入王舍城至王宮中，洗手足已敷座而坐。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān, dressed in robes and carrying his bowl in the morning, entered the city of Rājagṛha with a crowd of monks surrounding him, went to the king's palace, washed his hands and feet, prepared his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 時王見佛與諸苾芻寂然安坐，時影勝王自手斟酌種種美食，而為供養相續不絕，皆令飽足。
translation: When the king saw the Buddha and the monks sitting quietly and peacefully, King Jingsheng poured out various delicacies with his own hands and continued to offer them as offerings, making sure they were all satisfying.

source_sentence: 飯食已訖，王自行水。
translation: When the food was finished, the king helped himself to water.

source_sentence: 佛及苾芻澡漱已畢，王取寶瓶灌世尊掌，而白佛言：『我毘婆迦蘭陀園奉施世尊，唯願納受。』
translation: After the Buddha and the monks had finished washing themselves, the king took a jeweled vial and put it in the Bhagavān's palm, saying to the Buddha, 'I offer this offering to the Bhagavān at Vipa Kālāndāra; please accept it.'

source_sentence: 時佛世尊即說呪願頌曰：「『所為布施者，　　必獲其義利；　　為利樂布施，　　後必得安樂。』
translation: The Bhagavān then spoke a verse of the invocation, saying, 'Whoever gives to the world will surely receive its benefits; giving for the benefit of others will surely bring about subsequent happiness.'

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊說此頌已，與諸苾芻即便往詣羯蘭鐸迦園，止住其中。
translation: "After reciting this verse, the Bhagavān and the monks went to the Kalandaka Park and stayed there.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，結集尊者於經中說，佛在此羯蘭鐸迦園，乃至舍利弗目揵連出家，得阿羅漢道。
translation: Because of this, Venerable Bhaiṣajyaguru said in the sūtras that the Buddha stayed at this Kalandaka Park until Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana left home and attained the path of the arhat.

source_sentence: 「爾時王舍城中有一長者，請佛世尊及苾芻眾於家供養。
translation: "At the time, there was an elderly man in Rājagṛha who invited the Bhagavān and his congregation to make offerings to his family.

source_sentence: 於此之時，給孤獨長者別有緣事至王舍城此長者家，便即止宿。
translation: At the time, an orphaned man had another reason to come to this elder's house in Rājagṛha and stay there for the night.

source_sentence: 其長者於夜初分，即起呼諸家眷屬：『賢首！
translation: At the beginning of the night, the elder got up and called out to his retinue, 'Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 聖者可起取薪然火、濾水造諸飲食、掃灑塗地、敷妙勝座。』
translation: The sage may then get up, gather firewood and stew, purify water, prepare food and drink, sweep and smear the ground, and spread out a marvelous seat.'

source_sentence: 時給孤長者聞此語已，作如是念：『此長者家，為復嫁女？
translation: After hearing this, the elder orphan thought, 'Why did this elder's family marry his daughter?'

source_sentence: 為當娶妻？
translation: Why should I take a wife?

source_sentence: 為復屈勝上客？
translation: Why did he again overcome the most distinguished guest?

source_sentence: 為復請人？
translation: Why do we invite others?

source_sentence: 為復請國王家內設食？』
translation: In order to further invite the king to provide food in his house?"

source_sentence: 作是念已，復問長者向所念事，長者答曰：『亦不嫁女、娶妻、屈客并及王等。
translation: After he had thought this, he asked the elder what he had been thinking about, and he answered, 'I won't marry a woman, take a wife, submit to a guest, or go to the king.

source_sentence: 如所敷設，明日請佛世尊及僧伽苾芻眾，如法設食。』
translation: As it was arranged, tomorrow I will invite the Bhagavān and the saṃgha and the bhikṣu to serve food according to the rules.'

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者初聞佛名，遍身毛竪心生歡喜，問主長者曰：『是何名佛？』
translation: When the orphaned elder first heard the Buddha's name, his hair stood on end and his heart rejoiced, and he asked the elder, 'What is this called, Buddha?'

source_sentence: 主即答言：『有喬答摩沙門釋迦之子，從釋迦種中以正信故，剃除鬚髮、被著法衣，從家趣於非家，證得無上正等菩提，號之為佛。』
translation: The lord then answered, 'There's the Śākyamuni son of Gautama who, because of right faith from the Śākyamuni lineage, shaved off his hair, was clothed in the Dharma robe, left home and went to the non-home, realized unsurpassed correct enlightenment, and was called a Buddha.'

source_sentence: 彼復問曰：『何名僧伽？』
translation: Again, he asked, 'What's the name of the saṃgha?'

source_sentence: 主復答言：『有善男子從剎利種，以正信故，歸佛出家，剃除鬚髮被著法衣，從家趣於非家，名為僧伽。
translation: The lord answered again, 'Are there good sons from the Śāriputra tribe who, because of right faith, leave home, shave off their hair, put on the Dharma robe, and leave home and go to a place that's not home, which is called the saṃgha?'

source_sentence: 亦有善男子，從婆羅門種族、從薜舍種族、從戍達羅種族，以信心故，剃除鬚髮被著袈裟，從家趣於非家，出家修道，名為僧伽。
translation: Also, there are good sons from the Brāhmaṇa race, the Vaiśravaṇa race, and the śūdra tribe who, out of faith, shave off their hair, put on the reddish-brown robes, go from home to what's not home, and leave home to train, which is called the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 我請彼佛及僧伽眾，明日於此家中以食供養。』
translation: I invite that Buddha and the saṃgha to offer food to this house tomorrow.'

source_sentence: 復問長者：『彼佛今在何處？』
translation: Again, he asked the elder, 'Where is that Buddha now?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『今在寒林棄尸之所毘訶羅住。』
translation: He answered, 'Now I'm staying at Vaihāra, where the corpse was dumped in the cold forest.'

source_sentence: 給孤獨長者又復問曰：『我可得見彼佛不？』
translation: The solitary elder then asked again, 'Can I see that Buddha?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『汝可得見，然於此待。
translation: The elder answered, 'You may see it, but you'll wait here.

source_sentence: 若明日世尊至，汝必得見。』
translation: If the Bhagavān arrives tomorrow, you will surely be able to see him.'

source_sentence: 是時給孤長者繫念於佛，便即昏沈，忽然驚寤而天未曙心作明想，行詣善自在城門。
translation: Then, the elder Gokul, who was absorbed in the Buddha's thoughts, suddenly awoke with a bright thought before dawn and marched to the gate of the city of Śubhavyū.

source_sentence: 其國常法，夜分初更不閉，防外使來令無障礙，於後夜分城門亦開，用防內使無有障礙。
translation: It's a common practice in that country not to close the gates at the beginning of the night to prevent outside messengers from coming and making them unobstructed, but to open the gates at the latter part of the night to prevent inside messengers from being obstructed.

source_sentence: 給孤長者，見門開明隨明而出，既出城門光明即沒。
translation: An elder named Gokul sees the gate open and follows the light out, and then the light disappears as soon as he leaves the city gates.

source_sentence: 是時天暗，心生怖懼身毛皆竪。
translation: When the sky was dark, his body hair stood on end in fear.

source_sentence: 『我今於此，恐人及非人而見損害。』
translation: 'Now, I'm here, and I'm afraid that people, both human and non-human, will see harm.'

source_sentence: 作此念已即欲却迴。
translation: After thinking this thought, he then wanted to turn back.

source_sentence: 時此城門所居天神即放光明，從城門外乃至寒林，於其中間而皆大明。
translation: The god at the city gate then emitted a bright light from outside the city gate up to the cold forest, where there was great illumination.

source_sentence: 其神復報長者曰：『汝可前行，有大饒益勿生迴想。
translation: The god then again reported to the elder, 'Go ahead, for there's great benefit; don't give rise to thoughts of turning back.

source_sentence: 何以故？』
translation: Why is that?'

source_sentence: 而說頌曰：「『駿馬滿百匹，　　紫磨金百斤；　　馭牝兩車輪，　　其數皆有百。
translation: He spoke the verse, "He said, 'There are a hundred horses, a hundred pounds of polished gold, and a hundred chariots with two wheels.

source_sentence: 載以種種物，　　而用行檀施；　　不如發一步，　　向佛之功德，　　如是等校量，　　十六分中一。
translation: Carrying all kinds of goods and using them to give alms, how could they not give one step toward the merit of the Buddha, which is measured like this, one out of sixteen?

source_sentence: 假使象百頭，　　皆以金交絡，　　復載妙寶帳，　　而用行檀施；　　不如發一步，　　向佛之功德，　　十六分中一。
translation: Suppose there are a hundred elephants, each with a gold hem, and they carry a wonderfully jeweled pagoda and offer it as a donation; it's not as good as giving one step, which is one in sixteen parts of the merit of offering it to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 復有百美女，　　婇媛中最勝，　　頸絡妙珠瓔，　　臂搖眾寶釧，　　如是行檀施；　　不如發一步，　　向佛之功德，　　十六分中一。』
translation: Suppose there were a hundred beautiful women, the most beautiful of all living creatures, with their necks wreathed in marvelous beads and necklaces, and their arms shaking with many jewels, and they thus offered alms; it wouldn't be as good as giving one step, which would be one in sixteen parts of the merit of offering it to the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 「天復告曰：『汝可前行，有大饒益，勿生迴想。』
translation: "Again, the gods told him, 'Go ahead, for there's great benefit; don't give rise to retrospective thoughts.'

source_sentence: 時給孤長者而白天曰：『賢首！
translation: Then the elder Gṛdhrakūṭa said to him in the afternoon, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？』
translation: Who are you?'

source_sentence: 彼天答曰：『我昔是汝善友，名摩頭肩，我於舍利弗、大目揵連，甚大信心尊重禮拜，命終之後生四天王宮，為護眾生住此善自在城門。
translation: The god replied, "I used to be your good friend named Madhurā, and I had great faith in Śāriputra and Mahāmaudgalyāyana, honored and venerated them, and then I was born in the palace of the four heavenly kings after my life ended and stayed at the gate of this good, self-contained city to protect sentient beings.

source_sentence: 是汝昔友，今故相告。
translation: These were your friends in the past, so I'm telling you now.

source_sentence: 汝可前行有大利益，勿生退想。』
translation: Do not give rise to thoughts of retrogression, for there's great benefit in your going forward.'

source_sentence: 爾時給孤長者心作是念：『佛者，超出異生，不同餘聖，其所說法深可尊重，是故諸天見佛生大歡喜。』
translation: It was then that Gṛdhrakūṭa had this thought in his mind, 'That Buddha is beyond ordinary beings and unlike other sages, and his teaching is deeply respectable; therefore, the gods are greatly delighted to see him.'

source_sentence: 念已乘天光明即詣寒林。
translation: After he thought this, he rode the light of the gods and went to the cold forest.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知給孤長者來故，即出寺門而以經行。
translation: Knowing that Gṛdhrakūṭa had arrived, the Bhagavān left the temple and started walking through the sutra.

source_sentence: 給孤長者前至佛所，以居士法問訊世尊：『寢膳安不？』
translation: Gṛdhrakūṭa went to the Buddha and asked the Bhagavān, using the householder method, 'Is it safe to sleep and eat?'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以頌答曰：「『離一切煩惱，　　心不染諸欲；　　得無漏解脫，　　常得安樂眠。
translation: The Bhagavān then replied with a verse, "Freed from all afflictions, the mind isn't tainted with desire; attaining uncontaminated liberation, it's always possible to sleep in comfort.

source_sentence: 斷一切結縛，　　心息熱煩惱；　　寂靜得心者，　　乃可安樂眠。』
translation: He cuts off all fetters and bonds, calms the mind's burning afflictions, and attains quiescence of mind, then he can sleep soundly and happily.'

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊說是頌已，與給孤長者俱還精舍敷座而坐，給孤長者頂禮佛足退坐一面。
translation: "After speaking this verse, the Bhagavān returned to the monastery with Gṛdhrakūṭa and spread out his seat, and Gṛdhrakūṭa bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and withdrew to sit at one side.

source_sentence: 時世尊為給孤長者，演說妙法示教利喜。
translation: For that orphaned elder, the Bhagavān then explained the wonderful Dharma and showed him how to benefit and delight in it.

source_sentence: 如佛常法：所謂先說布施功德、持戒功德、受天果報功德，不樂諸欲過失受煩惱事，讚歎出家清淨觀察殊勝功德，宗法廣為演說。
translation: As is often the case with the Buddha's teaching, he first explained the merits of generosity, the merits of observing precepts, the merits of receiving the rewards of heaven, the displeasure of desiring faults and suffering afflictions, the praise of the outstanding merits of leaving home and pure observation, and the extensive explanation of the doctrine.

source_sentence: 世尊知給孤長者心生踊躍歡喜，心無障礙堪受勝法善能了知。
translation: The Bhagavān knew that the orphaned elder's heart rejoiced, and his mind was unobstructed as he was able to accept the excellent teaching and well comprehend it.

source_sentence: 是時世尊為說勝法，所謂苦集滅道，此四諦法廣大演說。
translation: The Bhagavān then explained the surpassing teaching, which is called the path to suffering, accumulation, cessation, and the extensive explanation of the teaching of these four truths.

source_sentence: 猶如離垢淨衣將染受鮮好色，給孤長者亦復如是，不離本座證四聖諦，所謂苦集滅道。
translation: Just as a pure robe free of impurity will stain and receive a pleasant, fresh color, so does an orphaned elder who doesn't part from his seat to realize the four noble truths, which are called the path to suffering's accumulation and cessation.

source_sentence: 給孤獨長者，以見法已得法、了知法深入法，斷諸疑惑不受他教，自能了知不被他引，於師教中心無怖畏。
translation: That orphaned elder sees the teaching, attains knowledge of the teaching, penetrates deeply into the teaching, stops doubts and doesn't accept other teachings, understands for himself and isn't led by others, and has no fear in the center of his teacher's teaching.

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者，從座而起偏露一肩，即於佛前合掌恭敬，而白佛言：『我已入法，一心歸佛、歸法及苾芻僧伽。
translation: Then, the lonely elder rose from his seat, bared one shoulder, put his palms together in respect before the Buddha, and said to him, 'I've entered the Dharma and wholeheartedly take refuge in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the saṃgha of monks.

source_sentence: 唯願授我鄔波索迦戒，從今盡命、永斷殺生、心淨歸依。』
translation: Please grant me the upāsaka precepts, so that from now on my life will end, I'll never kill again, and my mind will be pure and I'll take refuge in the Buddha.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告給孤獨長者曰：『汝名字何？』
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed the orphaned elder, 'What's your name?'

source_sentence: 長者白曰：『我名蘇達多，然我資給孤獨食，是故諸人號給孤獨。』
translation: The elder said, 'My name is Sudatta, but I provide food for orphans; therefore, they are called orphans.'

source_sentence: 佛告長者曰：『汝何處人？』
translation: The Buddha told the elder, 'Where are you from?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『在此北方嬌薩羅國室羅筏城外有邑，我住彼中。
translation: The elder answered, 'There's a town outside the city of Śrāvastī in Kośala to the north, and I live there.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊而受我請詣室羅筏城，受我供養乃至盡形，及苾芻僧伽四事供養。』
translation: Please allow me to go to Śrāvastī, accept my offerings up to the end of my life, and make four offerings to the monks and nuns of the Bhikṣu.'

source_sentence: 佛告長者曰：『室羅筏城中有寺以不？』
translation: The Buddha told the elder, 'Is there a temple in the city of Śrāvastī?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『彼城無寺。』
translation: The elder answered, 'There's no temple in that town.'

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：『彼若有寺，僧伽應來往。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, 'If there were a temple there, the saṃgha would come and go.

source_sentence: 彼既無寺，若為安置？』
translation: Since there's no temple there, what would be the place for it?'

source_sentence: 長者答曰：『唯願世尊而受我請向室羅筏城，我當造寺令苾芻眾往來安置止息思惟。』
translation: The elder replied, 'Please, Bhagavān, accept my invitation to go to Śrāvastī, where I'll build a temple for the monks to come and settle down to calm their thoughts.'

source_sentence: 世尊默然受請。
translation: The Bhagavān quietly accepted the invitation.

source_sentence: 是時長者知佛許已，即從座起頂禮佛足却還本處。
translation: Knowing that the Buddha had given his approval, the elder got up from his seat, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, and returned to his original place.

source_sentence: 「彼時長者，王舍城中事既了已，還至佛所頂禮佛足却坐一面，而白佛言：『唯願世尊遣一苾芻與我為伴，往室羅筏造立住處，安置世尊及苾芻僧眾。』
translation: "After he had finished his business in Rājagṛha, the elder went back to the Buddha, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said to the Buddha, 'Please let the Bhagavān send one of his monks to accompany me to Śrāvastī to build a dwelling place for the Bhagavān and the monks and nuns who are monks.'

source_sentence: 佛作是念：『苾芻眾中誰能調伏室羅筏城人及長者眷屬？』
translation: The Buddha had this thought, 'Which one of those monks can control the people of Śrāvastī and the elders' retinue?'

source_sentence: 世尊知舍利弗堪彼調伏，世尊念已告具壽舍利弗言：『汝應觀察給孤獨長者眷屬及室羅筏城人，應往教化造立毘訶羅。』
translation: Knowing that Śāriputra was capable of being subdued by them, the Bhagavān addressed Kauṣṭhila Śāriputra after he had thought about it, saying, 'Observe the orphaned elder's retinue and the people of Śrāvastī, and go and teach them to establish Vihāra.'

source_sentence: 舍利弗默然受佛勅已，頂禮佛足與長者同行。
translation: Śāriputra quietly accepted the Buddha's order, bowed his head at his feet, and walked with the elder.

source_sentence: 「爾時具壽舍利子，於夜分盡至明清旦，執持衣鉢入王舍大城次第乞食，却還本處飯食訖，攝衣鉢所有臥具，襞揲一處付餘苾芻，往室羅筏城。
translation: "It was then that the life-size Śāriputra took his robe and bowl into the great city of Rājagṛha to solicit alms in order from the end of the night until early morning. After returning to his original place for a meal, he gathered his robe and bowl, put away his bedding, gathered it in a place, handed it to the other monks, and went to the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時給孤長者資辦道糧，漸至室羅筏城外，遊諸園苑，林泉形勝可愛樂處，堪作寺舍。
translation: Gṛdhrakūṭa then gathered provisions for his path and gradually made his way outside Śrāvastī to visit various parks and gardens and places where woods and springs are beautiful and enjoyable and could be used as temples and dormitories.

source_sentence: 『去室羅筏城不遠不近，寂靜無有雜聲，亦無大風復不大熱，亦無蚊虻蛇蠍等。
translation: 'It's not far from Śrāvastī and not near there, but it's quiet and has no noise, no strong winds or intense heat, and no mosquitoes, stinging insects, or snakes and scorpions.

source_sentence: 有此勝地，為我世尊造立寺舍。』
translation: This is a wonderful place to build a monastery for our Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 給孤長者遊行，至誓多太子園林中。
translation: The elder Gṛdhrakūṭa marched to the princely garden of Vṛhatphala.

source_sentence: 其園去城不遠不近，晝夜寂靜乃至無有諸毒虫等，堪作寺舍。
translation: That park, which is neither far from nor near the city, is quiet by day and night and free of venomous insects and so forth, and could be used as a temple dwelling.

source_sentence: 見此園已，入室羅筏城不歸本住，便往太子誓多宮所，而白太子言：『可與我彼園，當為世尊造立寺舍。』
translation: After seeing this park, he went into Śrāvastī and didn't return to his original dwelling. He went to the palace of Prince Veda and said to the prince, 'Can you give me that park? I will build a temple for the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 太子報曰：『彼非是園而是苑林。』
translation: The prince replied, 'That's not a garden, but a grove.'

source_sentence: 長者復白曰：『無問園苑，處所與我。』
translation: The elder then said, 'Don't ask about the park, but give me the place.'

source_sentence: 如是三請，太子報曰：『我實不應而捨此園，縱得布金遍地，我終不與。』
translation: After these three requests, the prince replied, 'I really shouldn't abandon this park, even if I could spread gold all over the land, but I would never give it to you.'

source_sentence: 長者復白曰：『汝已定價，汝可取直，其園林屬我。』
translation: The elder then said, 'You've set a price, you can take it, and the park belongs to me.'

source_sentence: 太子報曰：『是誰定價？』
translation: The prince replied, 'Who fixed the price?'

source_sentence: 長者白曰：『汝自定價。』
translation: The elder said to him, 'Set your own price.'

source_sentence: 因即爭競不定，共詣斷事人所。
translation: They then competed indecisively and went together to the handler of the monk's office.

source_sentence: 爾時四天王聞斯事已便作是念：『今給孤長者為世尊造立寺舍，我當資助。』
translation: After hearing this, the four celestial kings then thought, 'Now, I will sponsor that elder Gokul to build a temple and dwelling for the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 作此念已，遂即各化為斷事人，於法司坐。
translation: After that thought, they each transformed into a handler and sat down at the Dharma temple.

source_sentence: 時誓多太子給孤長者，共到其處，給孤長者及太子各具因緣白。
translation: When the Vetāla prince, Gṛdhrakūṭa, and the prince arrived together, the Gṛdhrakūṭa and the prince each explained the reasons for their actions.

source_sentence: 斷事人議曰：『太子！
translation: The laymen said, 'Taizi!

source_sentence: 汝自定價，園屬長者，太子取金。』
translation: Set your own price, take the garden to the elders, and the prince will take the gold.'

source_sentence: 太子既見斷已，默然而去。
translation: After he saw that it was cut off, the prince departed in silence.

source_sentence: 是時給孤長者，還家勅諸僮僕，以車象牛驢擔負筐籠，運載其金，至誓多林用布其地，有少未遍。
translation: The orphaned elder then returned home and ordered his servants to carry the gold in baskets and cages on chariots, oxen, and donkeys to the Vedas Forest and spread it over a little ground that hadn't yet been covered.

source_sentence: 于時長者心自思惟：『若取大藏金即太多，欲開小藏復恐不足。』
translation: The elder then thought to himself, 'If I took the gold from the large collection, it would be too much; if I wanted to open the small collection, I'm afraid it wouldn't be enough.'

source_sentence: 又作是念：『諸藏之中何者不多不少，而得充足？』
translation: Then he thought, 'Which of these stores is sufficient, that's not too much or too little?'

source_sentence: 爾時太子見長者默住思惟，即便生念：『給孤長者心應生退，為一園林豈能捨此積集多金？』
translation: It was then that the prince saw the elder standing silently in thought, and even then he had the thought, 'Should the mind of that orphaned elder give rise to retrogression? How could he abandon this and amass a lot of gold for a single forest?'

source_sentence: 作是念已告長者曰：『汝心應退，當却收取金，其園還我。』
translation: After this thought, he told the elder, 'Your mind should retreat; remove the gold and return the garden to me.'

source_sentence: 長者告曰：『太子！
translation: The elder told him, 'Crown prince!

source_sentence: 我心不退，然心中所計，欲開何藏不多不少而得充足？』
translation: My mind doesn't retrogress, but what is the intention in my mind to unlock what store is sufficient without being too large or too small?'

source_sentence: 太子聞此語已便作是念：『世尊威德不可思議，其法亦不可思議，是故長者能捨積聚無量金寶。』
translation: After hearing these words, the prince then thought, 'The Bhagavān's authority is unfathomable, and so is his teaching; therefore, the elder was able to abandon the accumulation of measureless gold and treasure.'

source_sentence: 作此念已告長者曰：『其地金未遍處，應收却還，我為世尊而作寺門。』
translation: After he had this thought, he told the elder, 'Where there's gold on the ground that isn't already there, it should be collected and returned, and I'll make a temple entrance for the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『隨意可為世尊而作寺門。』
translation: The elder replied, 'As you like, I'll make a temple gate for the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 「爾時給孤長者為世尊初欲造寺，諸外道眾極生怨恨心懷熱惱，共集一處往長者所。
translation: "When Gṛdhrakūṭa first wanted to build a temple for the Bhagavān, a group of non-Buddhists became very resentful and agitated, and they all gathered at one place and went to the elder's residence.

source_sentence: 到已便作是言：『長者！
translation: When they arrived, they said, 'Sir!

source_sentence: 汝不應為喬答摩沙門造立寺舍。
translation: You shouldn't build a monastery for the Gautama scholars.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 我等先已分界，彼王舍城可喬答摩居止，此室羅筏城而我等住，是故不應造寺。』
translation: We had already divided the border, and that city, Rājagṛha, was a place for Gautama to stay, while we stayed in this city, so we shouldn't build a temple.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『汝等祇可分自國境，不應共分我園，我所造功德皆由自心。』
translation: The elder responded, 'You should only divide your own territory, not share my park; the merits I've created all come from my own mind.'

source_sentence: 諸外道等見長者堅意不移，即詣王所具陳上事，給孤長者共對獲勝。
translation: Seeing that the elder's resolve was unwavering, the heretics went to the king, explained all of the above, and gave the orphan elder a chance to win the battle together.

source_sentence: 彼外道心生忿怒面現惡相，便作是語：『我終不從汝志，然喬答摩沙門上首弟子，與我等共相論議，若能勝我隨意造寺。』
translation: That heretic became angry and had a bad look on his face, and he said, 'I'll never follow your wishes, but Gautama, the ascendant disciple of the ascetic, will discuss it with us, and if he can win over me, he'll build a temple as he wishes.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『可爾！
translation: The elder replied, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 然我且問舍利子，若見許可，即來報汝。』
translation: Still, I'll ask Venerable Śāriputra if he'll grant permission and come back to you.'

source_sentence: 長者即往尊者舍利子所，頂禮雙足退坐一面，而即白言：『大德！
translation: The elder then went to Venerable Śāriputra, bowed his head at his feet, withdrew to sit at one side, and said, 'Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 諸外道等皆作是語：「汝欲作寺，云我制汝。」
translation: That's what the non-Buddhists all said, "You want to build a temple, so I'll control you."

source_sentence: 又言：「喬答摩沙門上首弟子，今現在此與我論議，若能勝我聽汝造寺。」
translation: They also said, "Gautama, the ascendant disciple of the ascetic, is here now, arguing with me, and if you can surpass me, I'll listen to you as you build a temple."

source_sentence: 未審尊者，如何當擬？』
translation: How can you propose this, Venerable One, without having examined it?"

source_sentence: 舍利子聞斯語已，便即觀察此輩外道及室羅人民，頗有善根不？
translation: After hearing this, the Śāriputra then observed whether this group of heretics and Śrāvastī people had any good roots.

source_sentence: 既觀察已知有善根。
translation: "Having observed, they know they have good roots.

source_sentence: 又復觀察：誰有善根堪調伏不？
translation: Again, he observes, "Who has good roots that can be tamed?

source_sentence: 自心觀見我能調伏。
translation: "He observes in his own mind that I can control it.

source_sentence: 又復觀察：幾時應來集會？
translation: Again, he observes, "When should I come to the rally?

source_sentence: 觀見根器，却後七日可能集會。
translation: He observes his faculties and abilities, and then seven days later he might assemble.

source_sentence: 作觀察已告長者曰：『可隨汝意，却後七日我當論議。』
translation: After making this observation, he told the elder, 'Do as you wish; I will discuss it for another seven days.'

source_sentence: 給孤長者歡喜踴躍，頂禮舍利子足，往外道所而作是言：『聖者！
translation: Rejoicing and jumping for joy, Gṛdhrakūṭa bowed his head at Śāriputra's feet, went to the hermits, and said, 'Sage!

source_sentence: 舍利弗作如是語：「却後七日應當論議。」』
translation: Śāriputra made this statement, 'But for the next seven days, you should discuss it.'

source_sentence: 彼外道眾聞斯語已，共相謂曰：『有二種因緣。
translation: After hearing this, the group of non-Buddhists said to each other, 'There are two kinds of causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 何以為二？
translation: What are the two?

source_sentence: 一者舍利子必應逃走，二者應覓伴侶，以此之緣延期七日。』
translation: One, Śāriputra will surely flee, and the other will find a companion who will prolong the seven days for this reason.'

source_sentence: 外道復相謂曰：『我等亦可覓當宗知友。』
translation: The heretics then said to each other, 'We could also find a friend from the future school.'

source_sentence: 彼皆分頭散訪達本宗者，乃見一梵志名曰赤眼，善能幻化，既得見已便即告曰：『汝之與我同修道行，我等今呼喬答摩沙門上首弟子共為論議。
translation: They all scattered and visited those who had reached the school, and then they saw a priest named Red Eye who was skilled in illusions, and once they had seen him, they told him, 'You've been practicing together with me, and now we've called the senior disciple of Gautama the Saṃgha to discuss it with us.

source_sentence: 彼今已求伴侶，汝可共相資助。』
translation: Now that they've sought companionship, you may sponsor them together.'

source_sentence: 其梵志問曰：『幾時當論？』
translation: The priest asked, 'When will the discussion take place?'

source_sentence: 報曰：『却後七日。』
translation: He replied, 'But for the next seven days.'

source_sentence: 梵志答言：『可爾！
translation: The priest replied, 'That's right!'

source_sentence: 若會集時汝當報我。』
translation: 'You will repay me if and when you assemble.'

source_sentence: 諸外道等恐怖煩惱每日各更求覓伴侶。
translation: The heretics and others became frightened and troubled, and each day they sought companions.

source_sentence: 期程將滿至第七日，給孤長者於廣大勝地，為具壽舍利弗敷設師子勝妙高座，亦為外道而敷一座。
translation: On the seventh day after the completion of their journey, Gṛdhrakūṭa prepared a lion's high seat of great splendor for Śāriputra, the Arhat of Longevity, and one for the non-Buddhists.

source_sentence: 諸國外道皆集其會，及室羅筏城百千萬億一切人民亦集其處。
translation: Foreigners from other countries gathered there, and so did a hundred thousand million million people from the city of Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 其中或為看論議者，其中亦有善根成熟，俱來集會。
translation: Some of them were observers of the discussion, and some of them had matured good roots and had come to the assembly.

source_sentence: 爾時具壽舍利弗，與給孤長者及諸眷屬，前後圍繞而來赴會，遍觀大眾誰堪調伏。
translation: At the time, Kauśāmbī, together with the orphaned elders and their retinues, surrounded themselves in front and behind them and went to the meeting, observing the crowd and seeing which of them could be subdued.

source_sentence: 即便微笑整肅威儀，尋昇論座，一切大眾一心合掌瞻仰舍利弗。
translation: He then smiled, adjusted his demeanor, and ascended to his seat at the discussion table, where the whole crowd united their palms and looked up to Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗即告諸外道：『為我立宗汝破？
translation: Śāriputra then addressed the non-Buddhists, 'Are you refuting the thesis that I've established?'

source_sentence: 為汝立宗我破？』
translation: Do I establish a school for you and refute it?'

source_sentence: 外道答曰：『我先立宗。』
translation: The non-Buddhist replied, 'I first established a school.'

source_sentence: 舍利弗作如是念：『若我先立宗，人亦不能難破，除佛世尊，況赤眼外道！』
translation: Śāriputra had this thought, 'If I had first established a school, no one would be able to refute it, except the Bhagavān, in which case it would be a red-eyed non-Buddhist!'

source_sentence: 便作是念報外道曰：『任汝立宗，我當隨破。』
translation: He then had this thought in response to the non-Buddhist, 'Let's let you establish a theory, and I'll refute it accordingly.'

source_sentence: 彼赤眼善解方術，即便化作大菴沒羅樹，開花結實。
translation: That red-eye, who well understands the arts, even transformed into a large mango tree that blossomed and bore fruit.

source_sentence: 具壽舍利弗，為大風雨摧樹拔根，須臾散滅，時解術者而不能見。
translation: Kauśāliputra, a great wind and rain destroyed the tree and uprooted its roots, and it quickly disappeared, making it invisible to those who understood the technique.

source_sentence: 外道又化作一蓮花大池；具壽舍利弗化為象子踐池折花，尋復平地。
translation: The non-Buddhist also transformed into a large pond with lotus blossoms, and Kauśāriputra transformed into an elephant son who trampled over the pond, snapped up the flowers, and returned to the level ground.

source_sentence: 外道化為七頭龍王；舍利弗化為大金翅鳥，從空飛下食龍而去。
translation: The non-Buddhist transformed into a seven-headed dragon king, and Śāriputra transformed into a great gold-winged bird that flew down from the sky, ate the dragon, and left.

source_sentence: 外道化為起屍鬼，令前害舍利弗；舍利弗以呪呪之，令鬼却迴損害外道。
translation: The heretic was transformed into a corpse-raising ghost that caused him to harm Śāriputra; Śāriputra then incanted him with a spell that caused the ghost to turn around and harm the heretic.

source_sentence: 外道怖急下座，五體投地禮舍利弗，作如是言：『願救我命！
translation: The heretic was terrified and rushed down from his seat, threw himself down on Śāriputra's head, and said, 'May my life be saved!'

source_sentence: 願救我命！』
translation: vow to save my life!'

source_sentence: 時舍利弗攝呪力已，其鬼即滅，為赤眼外道說法，便發信心，從座而起頂禮雙足白言：『願聽我善法律中出家，受具足戒成苾芻性，求為弟子而修梵行。』
translation: After he had gathered the power of the spell, Śāriputra's demon ceased, and he spoke to the red-eyed heretic. He then aroused faith, rose from his seat, bowed his head at his feet, and said, 'May I be heard to leave home among the good Dharma, receive the full precepts, become a monk, seek to be a disciple, and cultivate the religious practice.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，時舍利弗，即令剃髮受具足戒，精勤修習不久之間，證無學果，三明六通具八解脫，得如實智：我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有，心無障礙如手揮空，刀割香塗愛憎不起，觀金與土等無有異，於諸名利無不棄捨，釋梵諸天悉皆供養。
translation: After he said this, Śāriputra then had his hair shaved, received the full precepts, and diligently cultivated them. Soon afterward, he realized the fruit of no more applied practice, the three insights and six powers, and the eight liberations, and attained the true knowledge that my births had been ended, the religious practice had been established, the task had been accomplished, I wouldn't be subject to a later existence, my mind was unobstructed like waving a hand through space, cutting swords and incense, loving and loathing didn't arise, observing that there was no difference between gold and earth, and observing that there was nothing to discard in terms of fame and profit, and that the gods of Indra and Brahmā all made offerings to him.

source_sentence: 是時大眾見此驚怪，各各嗟仰，於舍利子處皆發信心，作如是語：『聖者舍利子！
translation: When the people who saw this were astonished and admired it, they all had faith in Śāriputra and said, 'Noble Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 破大論議師調伏外道。』
translation: 'Refuting the great polemicists, he disciplined the non-Buddhists.'

source_sentence: 大眾一心合掌瞻仰舍利子。
translation: The whole crowd joined their palms in unity of mind and looked up to Śāriputra.

source_sentence: 是時具壽舍利子，知彼大眾意樂煩惱，六界自性了知說法，此是證四諦。
translation: Knowing the aspirations, pleasures, and afflictions of that great crowd, the life-size Śāriputra then explained the self-nature of the six elements, which is the realization of the four truths.

source_sentence: 彼大眾聞已，無量百千有情得大殊勝，有發聲聞心、有發辟支佛心、有發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心、有發三歸心受五戒、有證須陀洹果、有得斯陀含、有證阿那含、有得出家斷一切煩惱得阿羅漢果。
translation: After the masses heard this, measureless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings attained great distinction, some arousing the minds of the śrāvakas, some arousing the minds of the solitary buddhas, some arousing the minds of the unsurpassed three bodhisattvas, some arousing the minds of the three refuges and accepting the five precepts, some realizing the fruit of stream entry, some attaining once-returner, some realizing once-returner, and some leaving home to end all afflictions and attain the fruit of the arhat.

source_sentence: 是時大眾，於佛法僧所深生敬心。
translation: The large crowd then profoundly respected the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 時舍利子說是法已却歸本處，給孤長者及諸眷屬，一切人民皆大歡喜，作禮而去。
translation: After he taught them the teaching, Śāriputra returned to his original place, gave the orphaned elder and his retinue, and all the people rejoiced greatly as they paid homage and departed.

source_sentence: 「時諸外道心生惱恨，各相謂曰：『我等不能破得舍利子，我等須作方便殺彼舍利子，先須入此寺中傭力，作諸伺候得便之處，即須斷命。』
translation: "The heretics then became angry and each said, 'We can't refute the Śāriputra, but we must do something to kill him, first by going into this temple and using our strength to wait on him, then we'll lose our lives.'

source_sentence: 時諸外道詣給孤長者曰：『汝今奪我諸勝利養，我先久住不忍捨離此國，唯願慈悲，於寺中許我傭力。』
translation: The heretics then went to the elder Vikram and said, 'Now, you've robbed me of some of my excellent possessions, but I've lived here too long to part with this country, so please have mercy and allow me to serve him in the temple.'

source_sentence: 長者報曰：『待我白舍利弗。』
translation: The elder replied, 'Wait until I tell Śāriputra.'

source_sentence: 便即詣具壽舍利弗所，到已而白尊者言：『聖者！
translation: He then went to the living Buddha Śāriputra and when he arrived, he said to the venerable, 'Sage!

source_sentence: 今諸外道作如是言：「汝斷我諸利養，唯願垂慈，許我寺中有所傭力。
translation: Now, these non-Buddhists say, 'You've cut off my benefits, but please be merciful and allow me to have some employment in your temple.

source_sentence: 由我等久住於此，不能捨離其國。」』
translation: Because we've stayed here so long, we can't leave our country."

source_sentence: 舍利子聞斯語已，便即觀察：彼外道等有善根不？
translation: After hearing this, the Śāriputra then observed, 'Do those heretics have good roots?'

source_sentence: 既觀察已知有善根。
translation: "Having observed that they are known to have good roots, they then observe.

source_sentence: 復觀察彼等誰能調伏？
translation: Who can they further observe and tame?

source_sentence: 觀知我能調伏，告長者曰：『可然！
translation: He observed that he knew I could tame him and told the elder, 'Yes!

source_sentence: 終不相違。』
translation: There's never any disagreement.'

source_sentence: 彼外道等，即於寺內起首傭力。
translation: Those non-Buddhists and others then started to employ their strength inside the temple.

source_sentence: 時舍利子化作二執杖當諸作人，其性甚暴驅逐彼人。
translation: Śāriputra then transformed himself into two mace-wielding adepts whose natures were violent and drove them away.

source_sentence: 舍利子知彼等調伏時至，相去不遠，於樹林下而以經行。
translation: Knowing that the time had come for them to subdue him, Śāriputra went under a tree grove and started walking the sūtra.

source_sentence: 彼外道見經行已，便作是念：『比來伺候今正便宜。』
translation: When that heretic saw the sūtra being walked, he thought, 'Now is the right time to wait on that [man].'

source_sentence: 諸人一時而來圍遶。
translation: All at once, they came to surround him.

source_sentence: 舍利子見已，起觀察心：彼外道等擬作何意而來我所？
translation: After he saw them, the Śāriputra began to observe, 'What do those non-Buddhists want to do in order to come to me?'

source_sentence: 乃見彼等為害我故一時來。
translation: I then saw them coming at one time to harm me.

source_sentence: 此時化執杖人，即來驅迫以杖鞭撻，便即告曰：『汝等應往造作。』
translation: The man who had been trained to carry the staff then came and drove them away, whipping them with the staff, and then he told them, 'You should go and do something about it.'

source_sentence: 彼即同聲告曰：『舍利子！
translation: With one voice, they told him, 'Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 願救我等。』
translation: May we be saved.'

source_sentence: 舍利弗語執杖人：『汝且去，任彼止息。』
translation: Śāriputra said to the man holding the staff, 'Go away and let them rest.'

source_sentence: 彼外道便作斯念，共相謂曰：『此舍利子有大威德，我等皆發害心，此於我所而起慈心。』
translation: The heretics then had this thought, and they all said to each other, 'This Śāriputra has great authority, and we've all become harmful; here in my place, he's arousing compassion.'

source_sentence: 作是言已便生信心。
translation: After they said that, they then had faith.

source_sentence: 舍利子觀見彼等意樂隨眠界行自性，知已，隨其根器說四聖諦法。
translation: After observing their intentions and aspirations, the Śāriputra then knew the essential nature of their conditioned mental functions and explained the teaching of the four noble truths according to their faculties and abilities.

source_sentence: 由聞法故，彼等皆以金剛智杵摧破二十種薩迦耶見山已，現證預流果。
translation: As a result of hearing the teaching, they all now realize the fruit of stream-winner after using the vajra-wisdom pounder to defeat the twenty types of śākyamuni mountains of views.

source_sentence: 彼等見實諦已，皆白舍利子言：『大德！
translation: After they saw the true truth, they all said to Śāriputra, 'Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 唯願聽我等於善教法中調伏出家，受具足戒得苾芻性，我等於舍利子所可修梵行。』
translation: Please listen to us as we are disciplined by the good teaching to leave home, receive the full precepts, and attain the nature of a monk, so that we can cultivate the religious practice in Śāriputra's place.'

source_sentence: 時舍利子度彼外道授具足戒，教應作事，彼等漸次精勤修習，見此五種生死輪轉動搖，一切行趣摧滅，破壞離散之性。
translation: When Śāriputra had given those heretics the full precepts and taught them what to do, they gradually and diligently cultivated them, seeing these five kinds of turbulence and upheaval in birth-and-death, the destruction of all courses of action, and the destruction of their discrete nature.

source_sentence: 既了知已，斷諸煩惱證阿羅漢，三明六通具八解脫，得如實智：我生已盡、梵行已立、所作已辦、不受後有，心無障礙如手揮空，刀割香塗愛憎不起，觀金與土等無有異，於諸名利無不棄捨，釋梵諸天悉皆供養。
translation: Once they know them, they end the afflictions and realize arhatship, fully attain the eight liberations of the three insights and six powers, and attain the true knowledge that their births have been ended, the religious practice has been established, the task has been accomplished, they won't be subject to a later existence, their minds are unobstructed like waving a hand in the air, swords and incense are smeared, craving and loathing don't arise, they observe that there's no difference between gold and earth, and they don't discard fame and profit, which the gods of Indra and Brahmā all offer as alms.

source_sentence: 「爾時舍利弗與給孤獨長者，以手執繩量地置寺。
translation: "It was then that Śāriputra and the orphaned elder measured the ground with a rope in their hands and placed the temple there.

source_sentence: 具壽舍利子即便微笑，給孤獨長者既見笑已，尋即白言：『聖者舍利子！
translation: Even as he smiled, the long-lived Śāriputra saw him smile, and the orphaned elder then said, 'Noble Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 世尊及諸弟子，無因不笑。
translation: There's no reason why the Bhagavān and his disciples don't smile.

source_sentence: 今者微笑，有何因緣？』
translation: What's the reason why he's smiling now?'

source_sentence: 舍利子答曰：『如是，如是！
translation: The Śāriputra replied, 'So it is, so it is!'

source_sentence: 長者！
translation: Elder!

source_sentence: 世尊及諸弟子無因不笑。
translation: 'There's no reason the Bhagavān and his disciples wouldn't smile.

source_sentence: 今所笑者，當爾長者執繩量地之時，彼淨居天純金宮殿早已成就，以是因緣我今微笑。』
translation: The reason I'm smiling now is that when that elder measured the ground with his rope, the pure gold palace of that pure abode god had already been completed, and for that reason I'm smiling now.'

source_sentence: 長者聞已即大歡喜告舍利弗：『實若如是，更廣其繩大造立寺。』
translation: After hearing this, the elder rejoiced and told Śāriputra, 'If that's the case, expand the rope and build a large temple.'

source_sentence: 便發弘願。
translation: He then made a great vow.

source_sentence: 時舍利弗隨長者意闊引其繩，是時長者更廣發願大造其寺，時淨居天四寶宮殿還已成就。
translation: Śāriputra then drew his rope according to the elder's intention, and the elder then made a broader vow to build a large temple there.

source_sentence: 舍利弗見已歡喜復告長者：『彼淨居天由汝願廣，過前宮殿，四寶所成。』
translation: Śāriputra rejoiced when he saw this and again told the elder, 'Because of your vow, that Jingju Heaven has surpassed the previous palace in terms of the four treasures it's made.'

source_sentence: 聞此語已倍加嚴飾，更多造寺滿十六所，其置寺外，別造六十四院，悉皆重閣。
translation: Hearing these words, he intensified their decorations, built sixteen more temples, and outside of those temples, he built sixty-four separate courtyards, all of them with heavy shrines.

source_sentence: 既造了已，供寺所須家具悉足。
translation: Once they had finished building them, they were supplied with all the necessary furniture for the temple.

source_sentence: 爾時給孤獨長者往具壽舍利子所，到已禮訖在一面立問言：『聖者！
translation: An orphaned elder then went to Kauśālīputra, paid homage to him when he arrived, and standing at one side, he asked, 'Sage!

source_sentence: 世尊出遊日行幾許？』
translation: How many trips does the Bhagavān take each day on his travels?'

source_sentence: 舍利子曰：『如轉輪王所行之法。』
translation: Śāriputra said, 'Such is the teaching practiced by the wheel-turning king.'

source_sentence: 又問曰：『輪王日行幾何？』
translation: He also asked, 'How much does the wheel-turning king do each day?'

source_sentence: 報曰：『輪王日行兩踰繕那半。』
translation: He reported, 'The wheel-turning king travels two yojanas and a half a day.'

source_sentence: 時給孤長者，從室羅筏城於其中間，計兩驛半置四事供養，時、非時食悉皆充足。
translation: The Vikramāditya elder then left Śrāvastī and made four offerings between two journeys and a half, providing enough food for both regular and irregular times.

source_sentence: 建吉祥門立一首領，總知事務，嚴飾幡蓋及以寶幢，栴檀香水灑散其地，布眾名花，雜寶香爐置於衢路，作是事已告使者曰：『汝今可往詣世尊所頂禮雙足，當陳我言奉問世尊：「起居輕利、小病少惱、安樂行不？
translation: He built an auspicious gate, installed a first-in-command who had overall control of affairs, decorated banners and canopies with jewels, scattered sandalwood scented water on the ground, spread numerous flowers of renown, and placed a variety of precious incense burners in the thoroughfares.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊及苾芻眾，向室羅筏城，我以盡形四事供養，冀無闕乏。」』
translation: Please allow the Bhagavān and the crowd of monks to go to Śrāvastī and make offerings to them in four ways, hoping that there will be no lack."

source_sentence: 使受教已即往王舍城，詣世尊所頂禮雙足，即住一面白世尊曰：『彼給孤長者，頂禮世尊雙足而白世尊：「起居輕利、少病少惱、安樂行不？
translation: After receiving the teaching, he went to Rājagṛha, bowed his head at his feet, and stayed to one side, saying to the Bhagavān, 'Did that orphaned elder bow his head at the Bhagavān's feet and say to the Bhagavān, 'Do you live a peaceful life with few hardships and few afflictions?'

source_sentence: 唯願世尊及苾芻眾，向室羅筏城，盡我一生四事供養，冀無闕乏。」』
translation: Please let the Bhagavān and the crowd of monks go to Śrāvastī and make all four offerings in my lifetime, hoping that there will be no lack.'

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：『給孤長者及汝己身，願常安樂。』
translation: The Bhagavān told them, 'Give that orphaned elder and yourself the hope that you'll always be happy.'

source_sentence: 使者白世尊已，復白世尊曰：『給孤長者作如是語：「唯願世尊及苾芻眾，向室羅筏城來，盡我一生四事供養。」』
translation: After the messenger told the Bhagavān that he had been sent, he also told the Bhagavān, 'That's what Gṛdhrakūṭa said, 'May the Bhagavān and the crowd of monks come to Śrāvastī and make offerings to them in four ways throughout my life.'

source_sentence: 世尊爾時默然而受。
translation: The Bhagavān then accepted them in silence.

source_sentence: 使者見世尊默然受已，作禮而去。
translation: After the messenger saw that the Bhagavān had accepted it in silence, he paid homage and departed.

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊由自調伏故，調伏圍遶；自寂靜故，寂靜圍遶；自解脫故，解脫圍遶；自安隱故，安隱圍遶；自善順故，善順圍遶；自應供故，應供圍遶；自離欲故，離欲圍遶；自端嚴故，端嚴圍遶；猶如牛王，牛眾圍遶；猶如象王，小象圍遶；如師子王，師子圍遶；猶如鵝王，諸鵝圍遶；猶如妙翅鳥王，諸鳥圍遶；如婆羅門學士，學徒圍遶；猶如大醫，病者圍遶；猶如大將，眾勇圍遶；如大導師，行旅圍遶；猶如商主，眾商圍遶；如大長者，諸長者圍遶；猶如國王，諸臣圍遶；如轉輪王，千子圍遶；猶如明月，眾星圍遶；猶如日輪，千光圍遶；猶如持國天王，乾闥婆圍遶；猶如增長天王，鳩槃茶圍遶；猶如醜目天王，龍眾圍遶；猶如多聞天王，藥叉眾圍遶；如淨妙王，阿蘇羅圍遶；如天帝釋，三十三天圍遶；如梵天王，梵天圍遶；猶如大海，湛然安靜；猶如大雲，靉靆垂布；猶如象王，屏息狂醉，調伏諸根威儀寂靜，三十二相而為莊嚴，八十種好以自嚴身，圓光一尋朗踰千日，安步徐進如移寶山，十力四無畏大悲三念住，無量功德皆悉圓滿。
translation: 「爾時世尊由自調伏故，調伏圍遶；自寂靜故，寂靜圍遶；自解脫故，解脫圍遶；自安隱故，安隱圍遶；自善順故，善順圍遶；自應供故，應供圍遶；自離欲故，離欲圍遶；自端嚴故，端嚴圍遶；猶如牛王，牛眾圍遶；猶如象王，小象圍遶；如師子王，師子圍遶；猶如鵝王，諸鵝圍遶；猶如妙翅鳥王，諸鳥圍遶；如婆羅門學士，學徒圍遶；猶如大醫，病者圍遶；猶如大將，眾勇圍遶；如大導師，行旅圍遶；猶如商主，眾商圍遶；如大長者，諸長者圍遶；猶如國王，諸臣圍遶；如轉輪王，千子圍遶；猶如明月，眾星圍遶；猶如日輪，千光圍遶；猶如持國天王，乾闥婆圍遶；猶如增長天王，鳩槃茶圍遶；猶如醜目天王，龍眾圍遶；猶如多聞天王，藥叉眾圍遶；如淨妙王，阿蘇羅圍遶；如天帝釋，三十三天圍遶；如梵天王，梵天圍遶；猶如大海，湛然安靜；猶如大雲，靉靆垂布；猶如象王，屏息狂醉，調伏諸根威儀寂靜，三十二相而為莊嚴，八十種好以自嚴身，圓光一尋朗踰千日，安步徐進如移寶山，十力四無畏大悲三念住，無量功德皆悉圓滿。

source_sentence: 諸大聲聞及無量百千萬億人眾前後圍遶，詣室羅筏，到城外已欲入城門，纔舉一足登彼門閫，便即大地六種震動：動極動、搖極搖、震極震、東湧西沒西湧東沒、南湧北沒北湧南沒、中湧邊沒邊湧中沒。
translation: Surrounded by śrāvakas and a multitude of measureless hundreds of thousands of millions of people, they arrive at Śrāvastī and, after reaching the outskirts of the city and wanting to enter its gates, just lift one foot to reach the gate, and the earth shakes in six ways: it shakes violently, shakes violently, trembles violently, wells up in the east and disappears in the west, wells up in the west and disappears in the east, wells up in the south and disappears in the north, wells up in the north and disappears in the south, and wells up in the middle and disappears in the sides.

source_sentence: 於世界中出大光明，鐵圍山間幽冥之處而皆大明，天鼓自鳴，種種妙花霏霏亂行，種種妙香如雨而下，及天妙衣服如雨而下，一切隘路自然寬廣，坑坎之地自然平坦；城中象馬及傍生等，皆發音聲。
translation: A great radiance arises in the world, and the dark places between the iron mountains all become very bright, the gods sound their own drums, various wonderful flowers fall in disorder, various wonderful fragrances rain down, and the gods' wonderful clothing rain down, all narrow paths are naturally wide, and potholes and rough terrain are naturally level; elephants, horses, and other animals in the city all make sounds.

source_sentence: 所有家具資身之物，一時自鳴。
translation: All the furniture and necessities that support the body will sound by themselves at once.

source_sentence: 盲者能視、聾者能聽、瘂者得語、跛者能行、根不具者皆得具足、醉者自醒、遇毒者自解、怨酬者釋結、懷胎之婦無憂自誕、獄囚繫閉自然解脫、貧乏之者種種財寶自然充足。
translation: The blind can see, the deaf can hear, the dumb can speak, the lame can walk, those whose faculties aren't complete are all supplied, the drunk awaken on their own, those who encounter poison are freed on their own, those who are rewarded for their actions are freed from the bonds, a pregnant woman is born without worry, prisoners are naturally freed from bondage, and a poor man is naturally supplied with various treasures.

source_sentence: 「爾時世尊及諸大眾，既入城內，見是希奇種種異事。
translation: "It was then that the Bhagavān and the great assembly entered the city and saw these amazing and various extraordinary things.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊從室羅筏城中，與苾芻眾同至寺所，敷座而坐。
translation: The Bhagavān then went from Śrāvastī and went with the crowd of monks to the temple, where they spread out their seats and sat down.

source_sentence: 時給孤獨長者，并諸眷屬前後圍遶，俱詣佛所，金瓶盛水盥世尊手，其水不出。
translation: An orphaned elder and his retinue surrounded him and went to the Buddha's residence, where they were presented with a gold vase full of water to wash the Bhagavān's hands, but the water didn't come out.

source_sentence: 長者憂惱便作是念：『我今應有宿世罪障，令水不出。』
translation: Distressed, the elder then thought, 'Now, I must have some past-world sin that's keeping the water from coming out.'

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知彼長者心之所念，便即告言：『汝無罪障，此之寺地，汝曾往昔已造毘訶羅，施佛及僧伽。
translation: Knowing what the elder was thinking, the Bhagavān then immediately told him, 'You're not guilty of any hindrance; you've already built a vaihāra on this temple grounds in the past and given it to the Buddha and Saṃgha.

source_sentence: 汝今注水，非是昔日舊立施處，所以瓶水不為汝出，汝可移立舊施寺處。』
translation: Now, you're pouring water into it, but it's not the place where you used to give alms; therefore, the water in the pot won't come out for you, so you can move to the place where you used to give alms to the temple.'

source_sentence: 長者受教便立舊處，其水即出。
translation: The elder then accepted the teaching and set up his old place, and the water came out.

source_sentence: 世尊便出五種妙音廣為讚歎，欲呪願時，誓多太子心作是念：『唯願世尊先說我名。』
translation: The Bhagavān then produced five wonderful sounds, praising them in detail, and when he wanted to invoke the vow, Prince Vyāta thought to himself, 'Please let the Bhagavān first say my name.'

source_sentence: 世尊知已，隨誓多心告諸苾芻：『此誓多林給孤獨園，施佛及四方苾芻僧伽。』
translation: After the Bhagavān knew this, he followed Vyāta's thoughts and told the monks, 'This Vyāta Forest is an isolated park that's been given to the Buddha and the monks and nuns of the four directions.'

source_sentence: 是時誓多太子聞世尊先稱己名，即大歡喜起大信心，為佛造立寺門四寶所成。
translation: When Prince Vytautā heard that the Bhagavān had first called him by his own name, he rejoiced greatly and had great faith, building a temple for the Buddha that was made of four treasures.

source_sentence: 為此因緣結集聖者蘇呾羅中說云：『佛在室羅筏城逝多林給孤獨園。』
translation: It was said in the Sutra of the Sages who had assembled this collection of causes and conditions, 'The Buddha is at Anāthapiṇḍada's Park in Jeta's Grove of Śrāvastī.'

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶破僧事卷第八
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya-viṃśati-vāda-vikrīḍitā, vol. 8
